page.title: 10Farming in Brafferton
page.content:
One unusual aspect of the cattle rearing is the{intensive fattening}of bulls entirely indoors to reduce overuse of the land and to be independent of the weather.
The cattle are normally sold in Darlington cattle-market but some travel up to Hexham in Northumberland.
{Farmways,}the local corn-merchants, provide a drying and storage facility for the crop which can then be sold by the individual farmers.
About one third of a farm's acreage is devoted to arable, a third to grass land and the remainder is used for grazing.
Most of the farms are{family-run using no additional labour.
